actions-list.actionItem: Election of the Speaker The majority party nominated Mr. Johnson (LA) and the minority party nominated Mr. Jeffries. The election is now in progress.
The Clerk announced the appointment of the following Members-elect to act as Tellers during the Roll Call for Election of Speaker: Ms. Foxx, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Steil, and Mrs. Torres (CA).

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk announced that the next order of business was the election of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and that nominations would now be in order. Accordingly, the Honorable Lisa C. McClain of Michigan placed the name of the Honorable Mike Johnson into nomination for the Office of Speaker and the Honorable Pete Aguilar of California placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

The Clerk notified the House that he received a letter from the Honorable Matt Gaetz of Florida indicating that he will not serve in the House in the 119th Congress. Without objection, the letters relating to his resignation will be printed in the record.
The Clerk notified the House that election credentials for all Delegates and Resident Commissioners had been received.
Call by States Quorum responded: (Roll no. 1).

The Clerk announced that Certificates of Election covering 435 seats in the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress had been received and the names of those persons whose credentials show that they were regularly elected as Representatives in accordance with the laws of their respective States of the United States would be called. Without objection, the Representatives-elect were directed to record their presence by electronic device in order to determine whether a quorum was present.
The Clerk led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
House convened, starting a new legislative day, pursuant to the 20th amendment to the Constitution, for the meeting of the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress of the United States.
